# temperature

**Instance Property**

The color temperature, in degrees Kelvin, of the light source. Animatable.

## Declaration

```swift
var temperature: CGFloat { get set }
```

## Discussion

SceneKit determines the actual color of the light by multiplying the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/color] value by a color corresponding to the light’s temperature. The default value of `6500` K represents a pure white light (leaving the color unmodulated); lower values (down to a minimum of zero) add a “warmer” yellow or orange effect to the light source, and higher values (up to a maximum of `40000`) add a “cooler” blue effect.

This property affects all light types, but is especially useful when working with photometric lights (see the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/iesProfileURL] property) or physically-based rendering (see [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterial/LightingModel-swift.struct/physicallyBased]). You can leave the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/color] property at its default white color and use the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/intensity] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/temperature] properties to control the light using realistic parameters.

You can animate changes to this property’s value. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/animating-scenekit-content].

## Modifying a Light’s Appearance

- **type**: A constant identifying the general behavior of the light.
- **SCNLight.LightType**: Constants specifying the general behavior of a light, used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/type] property.
- **color**: The color of the light. Animatable.
- **intensity**: The luminous flux, in lumens, or total brightness of the light. Animatable.
- **sphericalHarmonicsCoefficients**: Data describing the estimated lighting environment in all directions for a light probe.
